page.title: 15Fishing in the Okement
page.content: The main watercourse in the area is the river Okement.It is formed by the confluence of the East and West Okement a little way south of Okehampton.Both the East and West Okement originate on Dartmoor, and the whole of the Okement is a 'spate' river. The water coming from the moor is acid with a P.H.value not much over 4. The river holds considerable numbers of trout of small size,and since the construction of the fish-pass at Monkokehampton sea-trout and salmon have been able to pass up the river. In the opinion of local anglers the river is adversely affected by various forms of pollution.
